page.title: 13THE INSTITUTE
page.content: The institute was once a public house called the Fishermans Arms. It as then turned into a library for fishermen to learn to read. It was completed in 1884, built by Mr Winn & Sons from Helston. Inside the Town Clock is a committee room and two bedrooms. The Clock Tower stands 70ft high and has a weather vane. There are four faces on the Clock Tower. Three of the faces are made of copper and are black and gold in colour. The one facing the harbour is made of opal glass and is illuminated by night so fishermen can see the time it is when they go out and come in. The town clock is at the foot of the pier. The numerals on the clock faces are Roman.
